snippet: Digging geothermal wells can be expensive and difficult, and the systems have been slow to catch on in New York City, but the benefits may eventually outweigh the costs.
abstract: Advocates for geothermal energy say the path of destruction cut by Hurricane Sandy, which unearthed fuel tanks and destroyed cooling towers and air-conditioners, has already persuaded some building owners to switch to systems that use underground pipes to harness the earth's energy for heating and cooling.
lead_paragraph: Digging geothermal wells can be expensive and difficult, and the systems have been slow to catch on in New York City, but the benefits may eventually outweigh the costs.

headline.seo: Geothermal Energy Advocates Hope Systems Get a Second Look
headline.main: Geothermal Designs Arise as a Stormproof Resource
headline.print_headline: Geothermal Designs Arise As a Stormproof Resource
